stimulusHtml: The graph shows the angular velocity of a rotating wheel as a function of time. A student analyzing the graph claims that the wheel has a constant angular acceleration. Is the claim correct? Why or why not?
choicesHtml: Yes, because the area under the graph is positive.
Yes, because the graph is linear.
No, because the graph is not a horizontal line.
No, because the graph has a vertical intercept of zero.
